item.title: DR Congo and Rwanda sign long-awaited peace deal in Washington
item.description: The deal has been hailed by President Trump as "a great day" but there are potential pitfalls.

item.title: A month into Gaza's new aid system - killings, gunfire and chaos are routine
item.description: A month into the resumption of aid distribution in Gaza there have been repeated reports of killings, with a BBC Verify analysis of dozens of videos s...

item.title: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
item.description: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

item.title: Iranian foreign minister admits serious damage to nuclear sites
item.description: Abbas Araghchi also says there are no plans to resume nuclear talks with the US.

item.title: Satirical Bezos mannequins pop up in Venice ahead of wedding
item.description: Unflattering installations depicting Amazon founder and his bride-to-be are attracting attention in the Italian city.
